commands.simplyhotsprings.placespring.no: Failed to generate a Hot Spring around %1$s %2$s %3$s.
commands.simplyhotsprings.placespring.to: There wasn't enough space above the bottom of the world for the Hot Spring to generate.
commands.simplyhotsprings.placespring.fa: Either there is a liquid above the Hot Spring or there weren't enough solid blocks to hold the Hot Spring Water.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.locationi: Checks your current biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the entity's current biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the biome at the position and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
Checks the given biome and whether Hot Springs can generate there.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.biomeslis: Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs.
Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs that CAN generate Hot Springs.
Lists all biomes known by Simply Hot Springs that CANNOT generate Hot Springs.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.biometype: Lists all biomes that are in the given Biome Dictionary Type.
commands.simplyhotsprings.help.placespri: Attempts to generate a Hot Spring centered at the position. If the north-west corner is air, moves down to the next solid block.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.no_world_gen: The "World Generation" config option is false.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_name_whit: This biome is in the "Biome Name Whitelist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_name_blac: This biome is in the "Biome Name Blacklist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_type_blac: This biome has a type in the "Biome Type Blacklist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_type_whit: This biome has a type in the "Biome Type Whitelist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.empty_name_w: This biome isn't in any blacklists, and the "Biome Name Whitelist" is empty.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.empty_type_w: This biome isn't in any blacklists, and the "Biome Type Whitelist" is empty.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.not_whitelis: This biome was excluded by whitelists.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.register_err: The Hot Spring placed feature failed to register! Report this bug!
simplyhotsprings.config.createsSources.t: If true, Hot Spring Water makes infinite water sources, like vanilla water does.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffect.too: The namespaced effect that Hot Spring Water applies to entities. If the given effect isn't found (or left blank), no effect is applied.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectTime: The duration of the effect, in ticks. 20 ticks = 1 second.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectAmpl: The amplifier of the effect. 0 is level 1.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.tooltip: Most of these settings require any open world to be closed and reopened.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.info.to:
The command "/simplyhotsprings" has a few subcommands that will help you fill in your whitelists and blacklists and test to see if they work. For example, "/simplyhotsprings locationinfo" will tell you the name and types of the biome you're currently in and whether Hot Springs can generate there. To see how to use "/simplyhotsprings", run the command "/simplyhotsprings help". 
(Also, this config setting does nothing, so put whatever you want in here.)
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.worldGe:
Set to false to stop Hot Springs from generating. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
The chance for a Hot Spring to generate is 1 over this value. So lower values are more likely. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.debug.t: When a Hot Spring generates in the world, prints the location to console.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeTy:
The biome types where Hot Springs are allowed to generate. If empty, all biome types are allowed. 
The Biome Type Whitelist and Biome Name Whitelist are not both required to be satisfied. You can use a period as a dummy entry. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

The biome types where Hot Springs are NOT allowed to generate. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeNa:
The individual biomes where Hot Springs are allowed to generate. If empty, all biomes are allowed. 
The Biome Type Whitelist and Biome Name Whitelist are not both required to be satisfied. You can use a period as a dummy entry. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

The individual biomes where Hot Springs are NOT allowed to generate. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeGr:
A list of biomes and their specific types of grass. 
By default, dirt around Hot Springs will be turned into grass. But some biomes have their own specific grass type which you need to tell Simply Hot Springs about. 
The format is "modid:biome;modid:block[states]". 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.client.alternate:
If true, Hot Spring Water makes small smoke particles instead. 
Note: these particles are affected by your particle video setting, and won't appear at all if it's set to Minimal.
